publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3756# Elaine Smith: UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003-That the Parliament notes the publication of the report The State of the World's Children 2003; commends UNICEF's commitment to monitoring children's rights and development internationally and congratulates it for its contribution for achieving the United Nations Millennium Development Goals: is concerned that the report shows that children's participation in society is largely undeveloped and that millions of children and young people have doubts about the usefulness of voting as a method of improving their lives and often do not see government leaders as role models; considers that the Scottish Executive should take all possible action to assist Her Majesty's Government in achieving the Millennium Development Goals, and supports the creation of a protective environment to allow children world-wide to grow up free from poverty, abuse, neglect and exploitation. # - Members' Business
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-3756# Elaine Smith: UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003-That the Parliament notes the publication of the report The State of the World's Children 2003; commends UNICEF's commitment to monitoring children's rights and development internationally and congratulates it for its contribution for achieving the United Nations Millennium Development Goals: is concerned that the report shows that children's participation in society is largely undeveloped and that millions of children and young people have doubts about the usefulness of voting as a method of improving their lives and often do not see government leaders as role models; considers that the Scottish Executive should take all possible action to assist Her Majesty's Government in achieving the Millennium Development Goals, and supports the creation of a protective environment to allow children world-wide to grow up free from poverty, abuse, neglect and exploitation. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Christine Grahame*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Alex Neil*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Irene McGugan*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Robert Brown*

S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Mr John McAllion*, Rhoda Grant*, Fiona McLeod*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Bill Butler*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Kate Maclean*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Dennis Canavan*, Robin Harper*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Irene Oldfather*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3756# UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003 (lodged on 8 January 2003) Susan Deacon*

S1M-3756# Elaine Smith: UNICEF Report, The State of the World's Children 2003—That the Parliament notes the publication of the report The State of the World’s Children 2003; commends UNICEF’s commitment to monitoring children’s rights and development internationally and congratulates it for its contribution for achieving the United Nations Millennium Development Goals: is concerned that the report shows that children’s participation in society is largely undeveloped and that millions of children and young people have doubts about the usefulness of voting as a method of improving their lives and often do not see government leaders as role models; considers that the Scottish Executive should take all possible action to assist Her Majesty’s Government in achieving the Millennium Development Goals, and supports the creation of a protective environment to allow children world-wide to grow up free from poverty, abuse, neglect and exploitation. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Ms Sandra White, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Irene McGugan, Pauline McNeill, Robert Brown, Mr John McAllion, Rhoda Grant, Fiona McLeod, Richard Lochhead, Mr Adam Ingram, Bill Butler, Sarah Boyack, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Kate Maclean, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Keith Raffan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Marilyn Livingstone, Dennis Canavan, Robin Harper, Fiona Hyslop, Irene Oldfather, Mr Gil Paterson, Susan Deacon
